p:
Defining the landscape of genetic regulation of gene expression in a tissue-specific manner is useful for understanding both normal gene regulation and how variation in gene expression can alter disease risk. In the latter case, a variety of approaches now leverage the association between genetic variants and gene expression changes, including colocalization analysis
1– 7 , transcriptome-wide association studies (TWAS)
8, 9 , and gene regulatory network inference
10– 16 .
